note: Year-to-year fluctuations in butterfly numbers are often linked to natural environmental variation, especially weather (unsmoothed index). We therefore used a smoothed index to understand underlying patterns of change.
title: Changes in UK butterfly populations

population.title: Population
population.content: A population is a group of individuals of the same species that live in the same geographic area. A species will often have multiple or many populations, each living in a different area.

subtitle: Changes in butterfly populations are measured as an index relative to [populations](#dod:population) in their start year (1976 or 1990 depending on the species group).
